question.title: What does it look like?
question.body: The grape you are assessing may be of a spherical or tubular type. It is easiest to assess the general shape by holding the grape in the palm of your hand and looking directly down on it (Eric Holland - How to assess grapes' shapes).

question.body: Spherical grapes will tend to have a very light aroma (Tariq Aziz – Words for describing grape aromas) It can help to bruise the grape slightly by gently squeezing it (Tariq Aziz – Bruising grapes without destroying them on the vine for a fuller picture of its productive profile (Repeat grape aroma test on grapes from other locations on the vine) .

question.body: Tubular grapes will tend to have a robust aroma (Tariq Aziz – Words for describing grape aromas) It can be worth assessing five or six grapes from different locations on the vine for a fuller picture of its productive profile (Repeat grape aroma test on grapes from other locations on the vine) .
